This is their new method of cheating. We place a food order, but they don’t have any delivery partners. We keep waiting, and in the end, when the order doesn’t arrive, we helplessly call customer care to cancel it. They ask us to wait again. No food, and the money is gone too. This kind of cheating is worse than begging to survive

Swiggy is generally convenient, but the way restaurants are shown in the app can be frustrating. Often, it highlights farther outlets instead of the closest ones, which unnecessarily increases delivery time to 45–50 minutes, even when the same restaurant has a nearer branch. As a customer, it would be much better if the app prioritized nearby stores or at least clearly showed all available outlets so we can choose the faster option. Waiting almost an hour for food when a closer store exists .
